page.title: 16LIFE STYLES
page.content: THE AXE AND COMPASS INN WOLVEY HEATH Robert Jones is the tenant of the Axe and Compass Inn. The inn was built in 1933 and the old Axe and Compass Inn was built 200 years before. The whole Inn is worth Â£350,000 today. An average working day includes going down to the cellar where he tastes the beer and drains the barrels that are nearly empty. He cleans the hose out twice a week and also the pipes. He ckecks that the wine racks are full, check minerals and the bottles of spirits. They open at eleven o'clock and are busy from twelve 'o clock 'till half past two. At half past two he helps to tidy up and re-peg the barrels. At five thirty he starts again. From five thirty 'till eleven the inn is very busy. From eleven 'till twelve he helps to clear up.At twelve thirty he goes to bed.
